ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great course, learnt a lot and professor was great. Lab component could be better organized as was discussed in class.
Lab section needs to be planned out better beforehand

The course is very interesting--a must for students interested in learning current topics as related to cancer genetics. I liked the idea of the lab component--I would suggest having each student be responsible for doing a small project over the course of the semester if this is feasible. I think this would maximize the learning experience in the lab and the presentation at the end of the semester could relate to this project.

This is a good introductory course, it covers a lot of useful material. The only drawback of this course is that it could use a dedicated lab where students can try the techniques that we learn in class.

I like the idea of having a lab course, but the labs didn't have enough work for the students to make them interesting. The material is really fascinating, and I felt I had enough of a background to understand it, but we didn't go really in depth with any part of it. More readings would have been helpful.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Yong Zhu  Open to feedback from students. Really nice, approachable professor. Great class notes.
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu is passionate about the subject
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Dr. Zhu is very knowledgeable about his field and presented well organized lectures. I think the lab component could be improved, however.
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Yong is a very good teacher, he aims to cover a lot of relevant material in a way that is not overly technical or stressful to learn.
Instructor: Yong Zhu  Not great at explaining concepts. Really interesting research, though. Topics could have flowed better. Lab component definitely needs to be improved.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great class. Learn a lot in a short space of time. Lab component is interesting but needs to be better organized.

The course provides an overview of basic and molecular genetics, as well as topics in epigenetics. The focus of the course is mostly on cancer.There is also a lab component which provides hands on experience.

I would recommend this only for a student that has little background in genetics. It is not thorough enough to be a course where students will learn a few things in detail but it is good enough that it covers most current genetic analysis techniques.

This is the first time the class was taught with a lab component. This could be a very interesting way to teach it if the labs are evaluated so students have enough work to do during them. Midterm was open-note, not difficult. Very interesting material, biology background required, finalpresentation only.
